summary: Build a premium, modern, fast-loading, SEO-optimized website for Ayanda Mdluli Attorneys (South Africa) using the provided brand context, color palette, typography (Raleway + Inter), and a phased homepage build (Hero/Trust, About/Approach, Services/How-it-Works, Testimonials/Partners, FAQ/Final CTA/Footer) with a final optimization phase (PageSpeed, schema, OG tags, caching, cross-browser, HTTPS).
architectural_notes: Mobile-first, fully responsive build with a consistent spacing system and scalable layout grid
Use clean semantic HTML5 with correct heading hierarchy (single H1; H2/H3 structure) and strong internal linking
Performance-first: optimize/compress images, lazy-load below the fold, minimize JavaScript, and avoid heavy plugins
Accessibility: WCAG-compliant contrast and ARIA attributes for interactive components (e.g., FAQ accordion)
SEO: meta titles/descriptions, alt text for images, Open Graph tags, and LegalService schema markup
Design system: premium navy + muted gold palette; typography limited to Raleway (headings) and Inter (body); minimal line-style icons (SVG preferred)

existing_features.title: Set up the global homepage styling foundation to match the provided brand system: Tailwind theme tokens for colors (#204257, #0a3653, #b98819, #ad7b32 plus white/light grey/dark grey), typography using only Raleway for headings and Inter for body, and a consistent spacing/layout system (mobile-first, generous whitespace, premium feel).

Implement Phase 1A: Hero section on the homepage with the exact content provided: single H1 'Trusted Legal Representation When It Matters Most', sub-headline 'Professional, accessible legal representation across labour, commercial, family, criminal, and civil matters.', two CTA buttons 'Schedule a Consultation' (primary) and 'Contact Us Today' (secondary). Layout must stack on mobile (text above image) and use a premium navy + muted gold aesthetic with optional subtle background accent.

Implement Phase 1 performance and accessibility requirements for the Hero: optimize Largest Contentful Paint by using an optimized hero image (compressed) with explicit width/height to avoid CLS, include descriptive alt text, and ensure any animations are subtle and do not trigger layout shift.

Implement Phase 1B: Trust / Intro section immediately after the Hero with the provided headline 'Proven legal experience. Measurable Results' and the trust indicators: '10+ years of experience', '1000+ Clients served', '100+ cases solved', 'R1000000+ settlements'. Design must be clean with clear separation from hero (white/light grey background allowed) and use lightweight SVG icons (no heavy animation overload).

Add Phase 1 on-page SEO structure for the homepage: semantic sectioning, correct heading hierarchy (single H1 in Hero; subsequent headings start at H2/H3 as appropriate for Phase 1), and natural inclusion of at least one primary keyword phrase targeting South Africa within visible copy (without keyword stuffing).
Add static asset handling for generated images: store required images under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend (no backend image routing).

Implement Phase 2 on the homepage by adding a new About / Firm Overview + Approach section immediately after the existing Trust / Intro section, using the exact Phase 2 content the user provided in their first prompt (no placeholder copy).
Create a dedicated React component for Phase 2 (About / Firm Overview + Approach) and wire it into the existing homepage composition (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx).

Match the Phase 1 premium, spacious aesthetic for the Phase 2 section (mobile-first spacing, navy + muted gold accents, clean typography) and maintain semantic/SEO heading hierarchy (no additional H1; use H2/H3 as appropriate for About/Approach).

new_feature_requests.summary: Develop Ayanda Mdluli Attorneys premium, mobile-first, SEO-optimized marketing website using the provided phased roadmap and homepage sections
Implement Phase 2: About / Firm Overview + Approach section on the homepage using the originally provided Phase 2 content and the same premium, spacious aesthetic established in Phase 1
